metadata.query: cap, relation model, er model, sql query, scaling

questions.question: Question 1: Which feature defines a relational database according to the Relational Model?

options.A: A collection of tables with unique names and structured relationships
options.B: A hierarchical structure of data organized in a tree-like format
options.C: A graph-based model representing data as nodes and edges
options.D: A single table storing all data in a flat file format

questions.question: Question 2: What is the primary purpose of an Entity-Relationship (ER) diagram?

options.A: To represent the physical storage structure of a database
options.B: To provide a visual blueprint of the database schema and relationships
options.C: To enforce data normalization rules in a relational database
options.D: To optimize SQL queries for faster execution

questions.question: Question 3: According to the CAP Theorem, what is the tradeoff in a distributed system during a network partition?
Question 4: In the Extended ER Model, what does "specialization" refer to?

options.A: Combining multiple entity sets into a single generalized entity
options.B: Subdividing an entity set into distinct subgroups based on shared characteristics
options.C: Defining relationships between entities using foreign keys
options.D: Enforcing constraints for data integrity across multiple tables

questions.question: Question 5: Which characteristic best describes NoSQL databases in relation to the CAP Theorem?

options.A: Prioritize consistency and partition tolerance over availability
options.B: Prioritize availability and partition tolerance over consistency
options.C: Guarantee strong consistency in all distributed scenarios
options.D: Use SQL queries for horizontal scaling across nodes
